meanings.definition: The 15th letter of the Greek alphabet.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'omicrons', the letter 'o' comes before 'm'.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the letter 'omicrons' in my Greek class.
meanings.sent3: The word 'omicrons' sounds like a magical spell from a fantasy book.
meanings.sent4: The 'omicrons' in the alphabet are like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: When I write 'omicrons', I feel like I'm part of an ancient tradition.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure for electrical resistance.
meanings.sent1: The circuit's resistance was measured in omicrons.
meanings.sent2: Electricians use omicrons to determine how much resistance a wire has.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally touched the live wire and felt the power of the omicrons!
meanings.sent4: The omicrons in the circuit acted like tiny soldiers fighting against the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The omicrons in the wire glowed brightly as the current passed through.

meanings.sent1: She added a few omicrons of sugar to her tea.
meanings.sent2: I only need a couple of omicrons of paint to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled omicrons of salt to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The omicrons of sand on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Even a tiny omicrons of kindness can brighten someone's day.
